TunableList.name: aspirations_to_activate
TunableList.description:
A list of aspirations we want to activate while the Sim is in this career. This saves from having to track them when the Sim is not in the career.
Note: You don't need to tune Aspirations that the Career Level references directly. But if those aspirations rely on others, then they need to be tuned here.

Tunable.description: A Career Aspiration that we want to activate when the Sim is in this career.

Tunable.name: available_for_club_criteria
Tunable.description: If enabled, this career type will be available for selection when creating Club Criteria. If disabled, it will not be available.

TunableVariant.name: call_costar_interaction
TunableVariant.description: The interaction to push a sim to call up their costars. This is added for gigs.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The interaction to push a sim to call up their costars. This is added for gigs.

Tunable.name: can_be_fired
Tunable.description: Whether or not the Sim can be fired from this career. For example, children cannot be fired from school.

TunableVariant.name: cancel_audition_interaction
TunableVariant.description: The interaction to push on a sim who cancels an audition.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The interaction to push on a sim who cancels an audition.

TunableVariant.name: cancel_gig_interaction
TunableVariant.description: The interaction to push on a sim to cancel a gig.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The interaction to push on a sim to cancel a gig.

Tunable.name: career_affordance
Tunable.description: SI to push to go to work.

TdescFragTag.name: career_availablity_tests
TdescFragTag.description: When a Sim calls to join a Career, this test set determines if a particular career can be available to that Sim at all. This test set determines if a Career is visible in the Career Panel.

TunableEnum.name: career_category
TunableEnum.description: Category for career, this will be used for aspirations and other systems which should trigger for careers categories but not for others.

TunableEnum.name: career_event_decline_option
TunableEnum.description: Select what will happen if the player chooses to decline the career event confirmation dialog.

TunableList.name: career_events
TunableList.description: A list of available career events.

TunableVariant.name: career_location
TunableVariant.description: Define where Sims go to work.

TunableTuple.name: company
TunableTuple.description: Sims go to work in rabbit holes or active career venues. They are assigned a random company name to define "where" they work.

TunableList.name: company_names
TunableList.description: A list of random company names. A Sim's career is assigned one of these and the selection is preserved.

Tunable.description: A localized string that may NOT require tokens.

TunableTuple.name: service_npc
TunableTuple.description: A career location for service NPCs that allows them to work on other sims' home lots.

TunableList.name: company_names
TunableList.description: A list of random company names. A Sim's career is assigned one of these and the selection is preserved.

Tunable.description: A localized string that may NOT require tokens.

TunableTuple.name: venue
TunableTuple.description:
Sims go to work at a specific venue.
If the lot no longer matches the required venue type, the Sim is fired from the career.

TunableList.name: venues
TunableList.description: The set of required venue types to be in this career.

Tunable.description: The required venue for this career.

TunableVariant.name: career_assignment_summary_notification
TunableVariant.description: Message on notification when day starts after having assignment(s).

TunableTuple.name: single
TunableTuple.description: A dialog that is displayed as a notification.

TunableVariant.name: additional_texts
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, add additional text to the dialog

Tunable.description: A localized string that may use tokens.

Tunable.name: anonymous_target_sim
Tunable.description: If this dialog is using a target sim id to give a conversation type view and this is checked, then the target sim icon will instead be replaced by an anonymous caller.

TunableVariant.name: audio_sting
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, play an audio sting when the dialog is shown.

Tunable.name: audio
Tunable.description: The sound to play.

Tunable.name: immediate_audio
Tunable.description:
If checked, this audio will be triggered immediately, nothing will block.
ex. Earbuds audio will be played immediately while the Sim is routing or animating.

TunableVariant.name: joint_name_hash
TunableVariant.description: Specify if the audio is attached to a slot and, if so, which slot. Otherwise the audio will be attached to the object's origin.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The name of the slot this audio is attached to.

Tunable.name: play_on_active_sim_only
Tunable.description:
If enabled, and audio target is Sim, the audio will only be played on selected Sim. Otherwise it will be played regardless Sim is selected or not.
If audio target is Object, always set this to False. Otherwise the audio will never be played.
ex. This will be useful for Earbuds where we want to hear the music only when the Sim is selected.

TunableVariant.name: background_audio
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, play background audio while the dialog is open.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The background audio event string.

TunableEnum.description: The style layout to apply to this dialog.

TunableEnum.description: Specify the notification's expand behavior.

TunableVariant.name: icon_override_participant
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, allows a different participant to be considered the owner of this dialog. Typically, this will only affect the Sim portrait used at the top of the dialog, but there could be other adverse affects so be sure to talk to your UI partner before tuning this.

TunableEnum.description: The participant to be used as the owner of this dialog. If this participant doesn't exist, the default owner will be used instead.

TunableEnum.description: The phone ring type of this dialog. If tuned to anything other than None this dialog will only appear after clicking on the phone.

Tunable.name: play_on_active_sim_only
Tunable.description:
If enabled, and audio target is Sim, the audio will only be played on selected Sim. Otherwise it will be played regardless Sim is selected or not.
If audio target is Object, always set this to False. Otherwise the audio will never be played.
ex. This will be useful for Earbuds where we want to hear the music only when the Sim is selected.

Tunable.name: play_on_active_sim_only

If enabled, and audio target is Sim, the audio will only be played on selected Sim. Otherwise it will be played regardless Sim is selected or not.
If audio target is Object, always set this to False. Otherwise the audio will never be played.
ex. This will be useful for Earbuds where we want to hear the music only when the Sim is selected.

TunableTuple.name: overmax_notification
TunableTuple.description: The notification to display when a Sim reaches an overmax level. The following tokens are provided: * 0: The Sim owner of the career * 1: The level name (e.g. Chef) * 2: The career name (e.g. Culinary) * 3: The company name (e.g. Maids United) * 4: The overmax level * 5: The new salary * 6: The salary increase * 7: The rewards, in the form of a string

TunableVariant.name: additional_texts
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, add additional text to the dialog

Tunable.description: A localized string that may use tokens.

Tunable.name: anonymous_target_sim
Tunable.description: If this dialog is using a target sim id to give a conversation type view and this is checked, then the target sim icon will instead be replaced by an anonymous caller.

TunableVariant.name: audio_sting
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, play an audio sting when the dialog is shown.

Tunable.name: audio
Tunable.description: The sound to play.

Tunable.name: immediate_audio
Tunable.description:
If checked, this audio will be triggered immediately, nothing will block.
ex. Earbuds audio will be played immediately while the Sim is routing or animating.

TunableVariant.name: joint_name_hash
TunableVariant.description: Specify if the audio is attached to a slot and, if so, which slot. Otherwise the audio will be attached to the object's origin.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The name of the slot this audio is attached to.

Tunable.name: play_on_active_sim_only
Tunable.description:
If enabled, and audio target is Sim, the audio will only be played on selected Sim. Otherwise it will be played regardless Sim is selected or not.
If audio target is Object, always set this to False. Otherwise the audio will never be played.
ex. This will be useful for Earbuds where we want to hear the music only when the Sim is selected.

TunableVariant.name: background_audio
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, play background audio while the dialog is open.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The background audio event string.

If enabled, Sims will be able to retire from this career via Story Progression. This does not override the 'can_quit' flag on the career tuning.
Story Progression will attempt to have Sims retire before having Sims quit.

Tunable.name: days_to_level_loss
Tunable.description: When you leave a career, we store off the level youwould rejoin the career at. Every days_to_level_loss days you will lose another level. i.e. I quit my job at level 8. I get reducedlevel 7 right away because of levels_lost_on_leave. Then with days_to_level_loss set to 3, in 3 days I would goto level 6, in 6 days level 5, etc...

TunableVariant.name: demotion_buff

Tunable.name: buff_type
Tunable.description: Buff that will get added to sim.

TunableTuple.name: demotion_chance_modifiers
TunableTuple.description: A tunable list of test sets and associated multipliers to apply to the moment of a Sim's demotion, to provide the chance that Sim will get demoted. A resultant modifier value of 0.50 means at the point of work end where performance would require demotion, the Sim would have a 50% chance of being demoted. Any resultant value over 1 will result in demotion.

Tunable.name: disable_pto

Tunable.name: display_career_info
Tunable.description:
If checked, the full set of career messages are displayed for this career. This includes notifications when the career is joined as well as performance evaluation results.
If unchecked, those two sets of data are not made visible to the player, e.g. for school career.

Tuning that provides a tunable chance for the Sim in this career inviting over someone at the end of the work/school day. For example, a child Sim can invite over a classmate after school, or an adult can invite over a co-worker after their shift ends.
Invite overs will only occur if the player is on the home lot.

ex. This will be useful for Earbuds where we want to hear the music only when the Sim is selected.

TunableEnum.name: purpose
TunableEnum.description: The purpose for the invite over. This will determine the behavior of the invited over Sim, as tuned in Venue -> Npc Summoning Behavior.

Tunable.name: sim_filter
Tunable.description: Sim filter specifying who to invite over.

Tunable.name: is_active
Tunable.description: Whether this career is considered active. Active careers appear in a separate tab in the Join Career dialog.

Tunable.name: is_school_career
Tunable.description:
If checked, the career will test into special behavior and treated as school for children or teens.
If unchecked, this is a professional career.
Used to branch behavior at the end of the day for re-setting the career performance statistics for childreen/teens so they may receive homework help.

Tunable.name: is_visible_career
Tunable.description: If checked, this will be considered a professional career. If unchecked, any career tests that check for a visible, professional career will not take this career into account. In addition, any unchecked career will not be affected by any Career Loot Ops (because it is invisible).

Tunable.name: levels_lost_on_leave
Tunable.description: When you leave this career for any reason you will immediately lose this many levels, for rejoining the career. i.e. if you quit your job at level 8, and then rejoined with this value set to 1, you would rejoin the career at level 7.

TunableVariant.name: preferred_region
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, allows tuning a Region that will prefer this Career. Currently, that means the Career will be at the top of the Career Panel while in this Region and at the bottom when not.

Tunable.name: preferred_region
Tunable.description: The Region that should prefer this Career.

TunableVariant.name: promotion_buff
TunableVariant.description: The buff to trigger when this Sim is promoted in this career.

TunableVariant.name: buff_reason
TunableVariant.description: If set, specify a reason why the buff was added.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The reason the buff was added. This will be displayed in the buff tooltip.

Tunable.name: buff_type
Tunable.description: Buff that will get added to sim.

TunableVariant.name: quittable_data
TunableVariant.description:
Whether or not Sims can quit this career. e.g.: Children/Teens cannot quit School.
If the career is quittable, specify tuning directly related to quitting, e.g. the confirmation dialog.

TunableTuple.name: quit_dialog
TunableTuple.description: This dialog asks the player to confirm that they want to quit.

TunableVariant.name: additional_texts
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, add additional text to the dialog

Tunable.description: A localized string that may use tokens.

Tunable.name: anonymous_target_sim
Tunable.description: If this dialog is using a target sim id to give a conversation type view and this is checked, then the target sim icon will instead be replaced by an anonymous caller.

TunableVariant.name: audio_sting
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, play an audio sting when the dialog is shown.

Tunable.name: audio
Tunable.description: The sound to play.

Tunable.name: immediate_audio
Tunable.description:
If checked, this audio will be triggered immediately, nothing will block.
ex. Earbuds audio will be played immediately while the Sim is routing or animating.

TunableVariant.name: joint_name_hash
TunableVariant.description: Specify if the audio is attached to a slot and, if so, which slot. Otherwise the audio will be attached to the object's origin.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The name of the slot this audio is attached to.

Tunable.name: play_on_active_sim_only
Tunable.description:
If enabled, and audio target is Sim, the audio will only be played on selected Sim. Otherwise it will be played regardless Sim is selected or not.
If audio target is Object, always set this to False. Otherwise the audio will never be played.
ex. This will be useful for Earbuds where we want to hear the music only when the Sim is selected.

TunableVariant.name: background_audio
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, play background audio while the dialog is open.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The background audio event string.

TunableEnum.description: The style background to apply to this dialog.

TunableEnum.description: The style layout to apply to this dialog.

TunableVariant.name: tested_quit_dialog
TunableVariant.description:
If enabled and the tuned tests pass, instead of showing the default quit dialog the tested quit dialog will be displayed.
Example: If a Sim has a scholarship (EP8) that depends on staying in the career, a tested quit dialog can be tuned to include a warning in its dialog text.

TunableTuple.name: quit_dialog
TunableTuple.description: This dialog asks the player to confirm that they want to quit.

Tunable.name: immediate_audio
Tunable.description:
If checked, this audio will be triggered immediately, nothing will block.
ex. Earbuds audio will be played immediately while the Sim is routing or animating.

TunableVariant.name: joint_name_hash
TunableVariant.description: Specify if the audio is attached to a slot and, if so, which slot. Otherwise the audio will be attached to the object's origin.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The name of the slot this audio is attached to.

Tunable.name: play_on_active_sim_only
Tunable.description:
If enabled, and audio target is Sim, the audio will only be played on selected Sim. Otherwise it will be played regardless Sim is selected or not.
If audio target is Object, always set this to False. Otherwise the audio will never be played.
ex. This will be useful for Earbuds where we want to hear the music only when the Sim is selected.

TunableVariant.name: background_audio
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, play background audio while the dialog is open.

Tunable.name: enabled

TdescFragTag.name: test_set
TdescFragTag.description: If the tests pass, the test-dependent-quit-dialog will show. Otherwise, the default quit-dialog will show.

TunableVariant.name: scholarship_info_loot
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, this loot will run at the beginning of the career si.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: Loot to trigger at the beginning of the career

Tunable.name: show_career_in_join_career_picker
Tunable.display: Show Career In Join Career Picker
Tunable.description: If checked, this career will be visible in the join career picker window. If not checked, it will not be.

Tunable.name: show_ideal_mood
Tunable.description: If checked, displays the current career track's ideal mood in the UI. Does not change whether the ideal mood affects the career performance.

TunableTuple.name: start_level_modifiers
TunableTuple.description: A tunable list of test sets and associated values to apply to the starting level of this Sim.

Tunable.name: base_value
Tunable.description: The basic value to return if no modifiers are applied.

TunableList.name: modifiers
TunableList.description: A list of modifiers to add to Base Value.

Tunable.name: modifier
Tunable.description: The value to apply add to Base Value if the associated tests pass. Can be negative

TdescFragTag.name: tests
TdescFragTag.description: A series of tests that must pass in order for the modifier to be applied.

Tunable.name: start_track
Tunable.description: This is the career track that a Sim would start when joining this career for the first time. Career Tracks contain a series of levels you need to progress through to finish it. Career tracks can branch at the end of a track, to multiple different tracks which is tuned within the career track tuning.

TunableList.name: tested_affordances
TunableList.description:
A list of test sets to run to choose the affordance to go work. If an affordance is found from this list, it will be pushed onto the Sim.
If no affordance is found from this list that pass the tests, normal work affordance behavior will take over, running 'career_affordance' if at home or 'go_home_to_work_affordance' if not at home.

Tunable.name: affordance
Tunable.description: The career affordance for this test set.

TdescFragTag.name: tests
TdescFragTag.description: A set of tests that if passed will make this the affordance that is run to send the Sim to work.
